extendedIngredients.name: fresh corn
extendedIngredients.originalString: 4 - 5 cups of cooked, cooled corn (I recommend fresh corn cut from the cob but any will type will work)
metaInformation: (I recommend corn cut from the cob but any will type will work)

extendedIngredients.name: juice of lime
extendedIngredients.originalString: the juice of 1 lime, plus a second lime cut up for serving
metaInformation: plus a second lime cut up

extendedIngredients.name: romano cheese
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 cup fresh grated Parmesan or Romano cheese

recipes.title: Mexican Crazy Corn Salad

winePairing.pairingText: Mexican works really well with Pinot Noir, Riesling, and Sparkling rosé. Acidic white wines like riesling or low-tannin reds like pinot noir can work well with Mexican dishes. Sparkling rosé is a safe pairing too. One wine you could try is Gary Farrell Russian River Pinot Noir. It has 4 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 42 dollars.

productMatches.title: Gary Farrell Russian River Pinot Noir
productMatches.description: The 2007 Russian River Selection shows tremendous concentration and power from this blockbuster vintage. Intense aromas of dark fruits, particularly cherries and plums, are matched with warm spices and a leathery earthiness. The palate shows great depth, weight and acidity with a seductive texture which leads to a balanced finish that confirms the nose. The 2007 Russian River Selection Pinot Noir shows wonderful balanced acidity and generous fruit that will pair beautifully with grilled rosemary pork tenderloin.

recipes.instructions: In a large mixing bowl toss the corn, cheese and avocado together.In a small bowl whisk the mayo, lime and chile powder together. Gently mix it into the corn until evenly combined.Season to taste with lots of salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature or chilled with lime wedges.

steps.step: In a large mixing bowl toss the corn, cheese and avocado together.In a small bowl whisk the mayo, lime and chile powder together. Gently mix it into the corn until evenly combined.Season to taste with lots of salt and pepper.
Serve at room temperature or chilled with lime wedges.
